name: Array comparison
instruction:
The function `compareArrays` takes two arrays.

It is necessary to check if the first array contains all the elements of the second array.

The second array contains any number of unique elements.

If it does, the function should return `true`, if not, `false`.

Fix the errors in the code so that the function works correctly.

The errors can only be in the syntax.

Example function calls:
```javascript
compareArrays([1, 2, 3], [1, 2, 3]) // true
compareArrays([1, 2, 4, 14, 5, 13], [1, 2, 3, 4]) // false
compareArrays([1, 2, 3], [1, 2, 3, 4]) // false
```
